entry.title: Flood Warning issued March 5 at 9:01PM CST by NWS Lake Charles LA
entry.summary:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Louisiana...
Sabine River Near Deweyville
For the Sabine River...including Burkeville, Bon Wier, Deweyville, Orange...Minor flooding is forecast.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 915 PM CST.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Sabine River near Deweyville.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 24.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CST Tuesday was 24.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 24.4 feet. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
entry.cap:areaDesc: Beauregard, LA; Calcasieu, LA; Newton, TX; Orange, TX

cap:parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued March 5 at 4:51PM HST until March 5 at 6:15PM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
entry.summary:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM HST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 442 PM HST, radar indicated that most of the rainfall was diminishing over the Kona slopes, with a few heavy showers lingering near Milolii. A gage on Waiaha Stream near Holualoa indicated that runoff remains elevated due to earlier downpours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kailua-Kona, Captain Cook, Honaunau, Kealakekua, Kainaliu, Honalo, Kahaluu-Keauhou, Holualoa, Kalaoa, Milolii, Hawaii Volcanoes Park Kahuku Unit and Kona International Airport.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 5 at 9:29PM EST by NWS Wakefield VA
entry.summary:
Areas of fog will be locally dense overnight and into Wednesday morning. Visibility reductions to around one half mile will be common, with localized areas dropping to one quarter mile or less at times.
If traveling in this area, watch out for sudden reductions to visibility. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 5 at 9:17PM EST by NWS Boston/Norton MA
entry.summary: Patchy dense fog is currently impacting the south coast of RI, MA, and the Cape and Islands with visibility reduced to as low as 1/4SM in many locations. Visibility is expected to improve over the next few hours as winds increase, thus, a dense fog advisory has not been issued. Motorists are urged to drive with extra caution through the midnight hour by leaving extra space between vehicles and reducing speeds in low visibility areas.

entry.summary:

entry.title: Flood Warning issued March 5 at 8:14PM EST until March 7 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
entry.summary:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia...
Yellow River at Pleasant Hill Road near Lithonia affecting Rockdale and DeKalb Counties.
For the Yellow River Basin...including Suwanee, Lawrenceville, Plantation Rd Lawrenceville, Tanglewood Drive Snellville, Lilburn, Snellville, Snellville, Lithonia, Stone Mountain, Silver Hill Rd Stone Mtn, Lee Road below Snellville, Lithonia, Lithonia, Lithonia, Milstead, Gees Mill Road, Snellville, Loganville, Milstead, Milstead, Milstead, Rocky Plains...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Yellow River at Pleasant Hill Road near Lithonia.
* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to early Thursday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding continues and expands further into the woodlands and fields near the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Pleasant Hill Road. In Dekalb County... some flooding of backyards of homes begin on Harmony Hills Drive and Court. Johnson Creek flowing under Union Grove Road into the river begins to back up.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 2.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 15.1 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.1 feet on 09/18/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
entry.cap:areaDesc: DeKalb, GA; Rockdale, GA

cap:parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON

entry.title: Flood Warning issued March 5 at 8:11PM EST until March 8 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
entry.summary:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia...
Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties.
For the Big Creek...including Cumming, Alpharetta, Roswell...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta.
* WHEN...From Wednesday morning to late Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding expands along the creek from near Cumming to Alpharetta and Roswell. Backyards of homes off Seale Drive and Gunter Court and portions of the Golf of Georgia begin to flood. The Big Creek Greenway experiences significant flooding up to 3 feet deep...which results in closure of most of the paths. This especially occurs upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and Rock Mill Park. A large portion of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will be under a foot of water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 3.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to 9.4 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning to 4.7 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 05/07/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
entry.cap:areaDesc: Forsyth, GA; Fulton, GA

cap:parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 5 at 6:45PM CST by NWS Brownsville TX
entry.summary:
Satellite imagery and webcams are indicating that patchy fog is developing across Lower Rio Grande Valley and South Padre Island, with visibilities being reduced generally to between 2 to 5 miles. Patchy fog will continue to increase further west and north this evening and overnight. Fog could be dense at times. Will continue to monitor for the possibility of Dense Fog Advisories needing to be issued later tonight.
Motorists are urged to reduce speed, use low beam headlights, and avoid tailgating in any fog.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 5 at 2:28PM AKST until March 6 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
entry.summary:
...ACCUMULATING SNOW FOR THE PANHANDLE...
.A frontal band which will impact the panhandle beginning Tuesday night and continue through Wednesday will bring accumulating snow. Snow amounts will be determined by how strong and quickly the front will brings winds down to the surface. As the biggest uncertainty is with changeover, advised areas could see higher snow totals than advertised.
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.
* WHERE...Pelican, Prince of Wales Island and Ketchikan Gateway Borough.
* WHEN...From 6 AM to 6 PM AKST Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Heavy wet snow will be difficult to manage due to high water content.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will quickly become wet and heavy as rates increase. Heaviest snow for Pelican and PoW Island will be Wednesday morning. For Ketchikan, heaviest rates will be late Wednesday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; Prince of Wales Island; Ketchikan Gateway Borough

cap:parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued March 5 at 2:37PM MST until March 6 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
entry.summary:
...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR NORTHEAST NM FROM 12 PM TO 7 PM MST WEDNESDAY DUE TO GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY...
.Good mixing of stronger southwest winds aloft, combined with very dry and relatively warm conditions will bring several hours of critical fire weather conditions to the northeast highlands and northeast plains Wednesday afternoon to early Wednesday evening.
The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 7 PM MST Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect.
* AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) from 12 PM MST to 7 PM MST Wednesday.
* 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...9 to 14 percent.
* IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeast Highlands

cap:parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM MST WEDNESDAY

entry.title: Flood Warning issued March 5 at 3:54PM EST until March 9 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
entry.summary:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...
Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Twiggs, Houston, Bibb, Monroe and Jones Counties.
For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Hawkinsville, Clinchfield, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon.
* WHEN...From Friday morning to late Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins along the river upstream and downstream from the gage at U.S. Highway 80 or Martin Luther King Boulevard. Portions of the Ocmulgee Riverwalk and agricultural lands well downstream will be under a foot of water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 12 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.0 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.0 feet on 03/14/1897. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bibb, GA; Houston, GA; Jones, GA; Monroe, GA; Twiggs, GA

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 5 at 6:35AM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
entry.summary:
Low pressure tracking into the gulf Tuesday will swing a front towards the panhandle. As the front moves over SE AK, precip is likely for much of the panhandle beginning Tuesday night and lasting through Wednesday. The last few days have been clear and cold so the area is set up for snow at the start. At this time, because the expected movement of the front is from west to east, the amounts of snow does not look enough for a significant winter storm.
Confidence is increasing on 24 hour amounts estimated between 4 - 8 across the panhandle. For snow type, areas along the coast and southern panhandle look to have dry, fluffy snow to start, but as heavier rates move in, snow will quickly become heavy and wet. For areas in the northern panhandle, expect snow to remain light, dry, and possibly accumulate quickly. Elsewhere, snow looks to begin as light and dry and slowly become increasingly wet.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Municipality of Skagway; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Glacier Bay; Eastern Chichagof Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Sitka; Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Juneau; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island; Prince of Wales Island; City and Borough of Wrangell; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Annette Island
